constellations_other.name: Processing grief through art
constellations_other.description: Thor: Love and Thunder begins with Thor meditating in a robe designed by Gumbaynggirr/Bundjalung artist Otis Hope Carey, best known for Ngalunggirr miinggi (healing spirit) (2020), a painting that expresses his grief over the loss of grandmother. Many artists process grief through their creative work.

results.title: The Frozen flame
results.brief_description: When natural gas is cooled to minus 161 degrees centigrade it becomes a liquid: liquified natural gas, or LNG. In 1959, Shell participated in the first ocean crossing of a cargo of LNG, marking the genesis of the modern LNG industry. In this video, projects in Brunei, Japan, Malaysia and Australia illustrate Shell’s history in the LNG business across management, finance, shipping and supply.

results.title: The Frog princess
results.creator_credit: Paul N Peroff and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which tells the story of a prince in search of a bride. He shoots an arrow into the air with the intention of marrying whoever finds it. But it is found by a frog, who is really an enchanted princess. Together they have many adventures until she is released from the spell.

results.title: The French Revolution: birth of a new France
results.creator_credit: George Vicas and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Beginning with the political conflict between leaders who felt that the revolution had gone too far and others who felt it had not gone far enough, this film examines the forces that shaped the Republic (for example, the film explains the opposition of the nobles and the clergy and the sense of conflict within the king and the rise of radical groups). With the failure of committee rule the leaders turned for support to the army and Napoleon Bonaparte and the revolution ended as it began, with one man rule. However the popular idea of sovereignty lived to change the face of Europe. Narrated by Michael Redgrave .

results.title: The French Revolution
results.brief_description: By re-enacting the experiences of M Roget, lawyer and member for the Third Estate, this film offers a brief history of the Revolution, from 1789 to Napoleon. Depicts the calling of the Estates General, formation of the National Assembly of the Third Estate, the discontentment and violence of the Parisian mobs. Follows events leading to The Terror and the final overthrow of the monarchy.

results.title: The French explorers
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Discusses French entry into the age of exploration. Tells of Cartier’s search for the Northwest Passage in 1534, and depicts Champlain’s 1603 expedition to the St. Lawrence River. Also shows the founding of Quebec and immigration of missionaries and traders.

results.title: The Freedom railway
results.brief_description: Looks at the Tan-Zam Railway (known locally as the Freedom Railway) which the Chinese have helped to build in Africa. 14,000 Chinese, working day and night with 40,000 Africans, have pushed this railway 1,900 kilometres from Dar es Salaam on the Indian Ocean to Kapiri Mposhi in the heart of Africa. The film conveys how the Chinese and Africans live, in their work camps, and the relationship which has developed between peoples of such different cultures.
